intro: Pulicaria gamal-eldiniae, commonly known as the Sudanese groundsel, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and latex-producing structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and grayish-green, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in compact clusters. Pulicaria gamal-eldiniae is often found in habitats with low rainfall and high solar exposure.
